The claim is supported by a statement ma: Roy Cooper in an interview with The News & Observer, where he stated, "It is embarrassing that 30,000 veterans in North Carolina have no health insurance and if we expand Medicaid 23,000 of them will."
The claim is also supported by a similar: where he said, "My opponent, Rick Gunn, blocked the expansion of Medicaid — costing half a million people health insurance, including at least 23,000 veterans."
PolitiFact conducted a fact: check on JD Wooten's claim and rated it as "Mostly True," indicating that there is some validity to the claim that 23,000 veterans in North Carolina were affected by the lack of Medicaid expansion.
Cooper: s office cited a 2016 study on the effects of the Affordable Care Act on veterans, which reported that there were 30,000 uninsured veterans in North Carolina as of 2014. This study provides additional evidence to support the claim.
